intro: Vasconcellia florida, commonly known as the Florida vasconcellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist, sandy soils. Vasconcellia florida is often used in restoration projects due to its ecological importance and ability to stabilize soil in aquatic environments.
